sentences.sContent: Her body was already starting to decay.
sentences.sCn: 她的尸体已经开始腐烂。

sentences.sContent: Most archaeological finds are broken, damaged, or decayed.
sentences.sCn: 大部分考古发现物都已破裂、损坏或腐烂。

synos.tran: 衰退，[核]衰减；腐烂，[木]腐朽
衰退，[核]衰减；腐烂，[木]腐朽
使腐烂，使腐败；使衰退，使衰落

phrases.pCn: 衰减率；衰变率；衰变速度
衰变曲线；衰减曲线；退化曲线；余辉曲线

trans.tranCn: 衰退，[核] 衰减；腐烂，腐朽
trans.tranOther: to be slowly destroyed by a natural chemical process, or to make something do this

trans.tranCn: 衰退，[核] 衰减；腐烂，腐朽
trans.tranOther: the natural chemical change that causes the slow destruction of something
